paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted genetic variant information specifically for the BRCA2 gene, including penetrance data.

patients.phenotype: Breast cancer diagnosed at age 53, with two affected first-degree relatives.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: The heterozygous missense variant c.72A > T (Leu24Phe), was observed in 1 of 82 (1.2%) women but not in population controls.

functional_data.summary: Predicted to significantly change the properties of the side chain and the substitution would not be tolerated.

variants.segregation_data: Segregates with disease in family (two affected first-degree relatives).
variants.evidence_level: Likely pathogenic based on in silico predictions.
variants.additional_notes: No deletions or duplications were identified in BRCA2.
key_quotes: One of the novel variants, BRCA2 c.72A > T (Leu24Phe) was predicted to be likely pathogenic in silico.
The c.72A > T variant carrying woman had BrCa diagnosed at the age of 53 years.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data for BRCA2 variants were extracted successfully.
